Title: Data Scientist Trainee
Description:
Job Location

WARSAW DOWNTOWN OFFICE

Job Description

We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist Trainee who is eager to kickstart their career and take on a new challenge! This is a part-time, fixed term position (up to 0.8 FTE, up to 12 months) enabling you to get into the world of serious Data Science projects.

P&G Scaled Data Science Hub in Warsaw is dynamically growing and making an impact across key algorithmic investments of the Company. We work on various problems and algorithmic products related to Retail, Media, Digital commerce, R&D, Supply Chain, Productivity, Knowledge management, and more.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn about a specific business area and support algorithmic model needs. Our work spans traditional machine learning, deep learning, GenAI, optimization models, and statistical models, with a focus on understanding and addressing real-world problems.

At the Warsaw Hub, we specialize in developing and scaling algorithms while emphasizing impact, value, resilience, and reliability. Your contributions will support P&G's 100k+ employees and billions of consumers around the world.

You will join a world-class company that improves the lives of billions of consumers through data science. You’ll be welcomed into a global team of over 200 Data Scientists across the US, Panama, Switzerland, Belgium, Poland, Singapore, India, and China. This environment will provide you with ample networking and learning opportunities from scientists with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Additionally, our Warsaw Hub emphasizes knowledge sharing on a weekly basis, allowing you to gain exposure to various aspects of data science beyond your immediate responsibilities.

You will have the chance to work with our best-in-class P&G AI Factory platform, which is recognized by Harvard Business School, and contribute to improving our developer experience alongside our strong AI Engineering team.

With us, you will:


Collaborate with product teams and business leaders to gain insights into the problems at hand, and work with AI & data engineering teams to support the automation and deployment of models.
Assist in developing insights to contribute to the algorithmic evolution roadmap in your area of interest.
Analyze data sets and learn how to translate consumer behaviors into actionable recommendations.
Explore and apply machine learning techniques and algorithms to address business questions and propose solutions (the key focus for this traineeship with be GenAI).
Gain a deeper understanding of machine learning, statistics, optimization, GenAI, and other advanced analytical models as they relate to real-world applications.
Learn what it takes to build and maintain a resilient algorithmic pipeline, and understand how to measure an algorithm's impact and value.
Write production-level code following best practices and improve your programming skills.


Job Qualifications


3rd, 4th, 5th year students or graduates - with a real passion for data science or related field; (Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc).
Prior internships in data science or algorithmically enabled applications or involvement in data science projects preferred.
Familiarity and hands-on exposure to GenAI topics.
Familiarity with Cloud Infrastructure (e.g., Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform) is advantageous.
Intermediate coding skills in Python; knowledge of Spark is a plus.
Strong analytical skills (e.g., SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling) are desirable.
A willingness to learn and adapt, with a passion for problem-solving.
Strong collaboration skills and comfort working in diverse teams.


Nice to Have:


Exposure to Big Data ecosystems (e.g., Databricks, Spark, BigQuery) is a plus.
Understanding of Business Intelligence Tools such as PowerBI or Tableau.
Familiarity with Agile DevOps practices, and tools like GitHub, Jira, and Confluence would be advantageous.


We offer:


Attractive salary: 10 900 PLN gross/month
Working from the Warsaw office three times a week, including partially remote work;
P&G-sized projects and access to world leading IT partners and technologies from Day 1;
Work in international teams with global or regional responsibilities;
Work with industry leading technologies, platforms and tools;
Mentoring programs, training and relevant certifications;
Opportunity to participate in P&G voluntary charity programs;
Additionally, we offer the Flex Fund benefit – empowering you to craft a personalized benefits package tailored to your unique needs, priorities, and life stages. Whether you prioritize health and wellness or crave the perfect work-life balance, seize the freedom to select what truly matters to you.


Just so you know

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000137340

Job Segmentation

Internships

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Docsity is an educational community where millions of university students share and find study content to improve their exam preparation. Our mission is to help students to be more effective in their preparation, and connect them with meaningful learning opportunities.




We are managing this recruitment process in collaboration with one of our strategic partner companies, who are looking for talented individuals to join their team.




The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.




About the role:

You will collaborate closely with interdisciplinary teams to design and implement advanced AI solutions that drive decision-making and innovation. Your daily activities will include:

Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, and structuring for downstream processing
Develop architectures to streamline data science processes
Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Promote data-based decision-making across the company through reports and presentations
Develop insightful dashboards to track performances




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Great analytical skills and attention to detail, insights-driven attitude
Fluency in Python, Pandas, and database technology (SQL, schema design and query optimization techniques)
Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
Understanding of full software development life cycle and agile development
Proficiency in Italian (B2+)




Nice to have

experience in Large Language Models APIs or quantitative analytics or data modeling is a plus
Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
Experience on Ecommerce and digital marketing metrics
Expertise in using scalable analytics techniques (e.g., PySpark, Dask, Modin, Koalas) and MPP databases (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) for complex data assembly and transformation




What’s in it for you?

Work with tons of data, to which you will have full access
Work closely with all functions within the organization
You’ll have the unique chance to work on high-impact Data/AI projects within a large-scale organization where your contributions will drive tangible change
Work in a highly-skilled, organized and cross-functional Data Team
Opportunity to grow personally and professionally through training and peer interaction
Hybrid work structure: 4 days in the office and 1 day of smart working per week.
Show more
HTML:
Docsity is an educational community where millions of university students share and find study content to improve their exam preparation. Our mission is to help students to be more effective in their preparation, and connect them with meaningful learning opportunities.


We are managing this recruitment process in collaboration with one of our strategic partner companies, who are looking for talented individuals to join their team.


The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.


About the role:

You will collaborate closely with interdisciplinary teams to design and implement advanced AI solutions that drive decision-making and innovation. Your daily activities will include:

  • Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, and structuring for downstream processing
  • Develop architectures to streamline data science processes
  • Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization
  • Promote data-based decision-making across the company through reports and presentations
  • Develop insightful dashboards to track performances


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Great analytical skills and attention to detail, insights-driven attitude
  • Fluency in Python, Pandas, and database technology (SQL, schema design and query optimization techniques)
  • Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
  • Understanding of full software development life cycle and agile development
  • Proficiency in Italian (B2+)


Nice to have

  • experience in Large Language Models APIs or quantitative analytics or data modeling is a plus
  • Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
  • Experience on Ecommerce and digital marketing metrics
  • Expertise in using scalable analytics techniques (e.g., PySpark, Dask, Modin, Koalas) and MPP databases (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) for complex data assembly and transformation


What’s in it for you?

  • Work with tons of data, to which you will have full access
  • Work closely with all functions within the organization
  • You’ll have the unique chance to work on high-impact Data/AI projects within a large-scale organization where your contributions will drive tangible change
  • Work in a highly-skilled, organized and cross-functional Data Team
  • Opportunity to grow personally and professionally through training and peer interaction
  • Hybrid work structure: 4 days in the office and 1 day of smart working per week.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 219,000+ people across 54 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud.




The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be.




If all this sounds like an environment you’ll thrive in, then you’re in the right place. Join us on our journey to advancing the technological world through innovation and creativity.

______________________________________________________________

Job Summary

The Senior Data Scientist will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, developing custom models and algorithms to drive business solutions, and creating visualizations using Power BI. The role will involve collaborating with cross functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.




Key Responsibilities

1. Analyze and interpret large and complex data sets to discover insights and identify trends.

2. Develop and implement custom machine learning models and algorithms to support business objectives.

3. Create interactive and insightful visualizations using power bi to present data driven insights to stakeholders.

4. Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their goals and translate them into technical requirements.

5. Work closely with data engineers to ensure data quality and accuracy for analysis.

6. Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in data science to continuously improve data methodologies.




Skill Requirements

1. Strong proficiency in data science techniques and tools such as machine learning, statistical modeling, and data mining.

2. Proficiency in power bi for data visualization and reporting.

3. Advanced programming skills in python for data analysis and model development.

4. Solid understanding of database management and sql for data querying and manipulation.

5. Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey complex findings and insights to nontechnical stakeholders.

6. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to tackle complex data challenges efficiently.




Certifications: Relevant certifications in data science, Power BI, and Python are a plus.




Why Us?

We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 50+ countries across the globe and 219,000 employees
Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented
We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues across the globe
We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good work-life integration and real flexibility
We are invested in your growth, offering learning and career development opportunities at every level to help you find your own unique spark




Benefit package

Life insurance
Private medical care
MultiSport Card
Subsidy for glasses
Subsidy to language courses
Christmas and holiday bonuses
Clear career path in a growing multinational organization

Show more

Title: Data scientist H/F
Company: DGSI - Direction Générale de la Sécurité Intérieure
HTML:
La DGSI est un service de renseignement français relevant du ministère de l’Intérieur. Travailler à la DGSI, c’est être au cœur des enjeux du 21e siècle et participer à la protection des français en mettant ses compétences au service de l’État, à travers des missions telles que la lutte contre le terrorisme et les extrémismes violents, le contre-espionnage, la protection économique et la contre prolifération et la cyberdéfense.


Vos missions :


Vous rejoignez la division de la gestion de la donnée pour concevoir et réaliser des solutions basées sur l'IA générative au service de la Direction et dans les différentes thématiques traitées par le service.


Placé(e) sous l'autorité du chef de section, vous assurez les missions suivantes :

  • Analyser les besoins opérationnels et concevoir des solutions techniques pertinentes pour y répondre, notamment basées sur l'écosystème des IA génératives ;
  • Comparer des performances de solutions d'IA génératives avec des solutions d'apprentissage automatiques "classiques" sur certains cas d'usages ;
  • Sélectionner des métriques et établir des protocoles expérimentaux au service d'une méthodologie scientifique d'évolution et amélioration des solutions techniques développées.
  • Participer à la collecte et à la création de jeux de données d'évaluation permettant de s'assurer de l'adéquation entre pertinence des solutions développées et besoins opérationnels ;
  • Assurer l'explicabilité des résultats et des sources informationnelles (RAG) des IA génératives afin d'accompagner et d'acculturer les utilisateurs sur ces nouvelles technologies ;
  • Développer des preuves de concept et prototypes techniques en s'appuyant sur des modèles d'IA générative aux architectures récentes type Large Language Models et capitalisant sur des retours d'utilisateurs clés, collectés lors de phases de tests ;
  • Concevoir des chaînes de traitements optimisés pour servir plusieurs milliers d'utilisateurs en utilisant des outils modernes du domaines du MLOPS ;
  • Réaliser une veille technologique active dans le domaine des sciences de données et identifier solutions récentes à forte valeur ajoutée technique (système multi-agents, DLLM, MCP, SLM, système LLM hybride).


Vous donnez ainsi les moyens aux différents métiers d’acquérir efficacité, pertinence, précision et autonomie, au travers d'outils et de méthodes innovantes.


Votre profil :


Vous êtes issu d'une formation bac+5 avec une spécialisation Data Science et une expérience professionnelle minimale de 3 ans dans le domaine des sciences des données en particulier sur les sujets de traitement automatique des langues et d'IA génératives.

Vous maîtrisez les techniques liées à l'apprentissage machine (en particulier dans le sous-domaine des IA génératives) : évaluation, entraînement/renforcement, mise en place d'architectures spécifiques (type RAG), optimisation et déploiement des modèles.

Vous maîtrisez également les outils et méthodes permettant l'explicabilité des modèles et de leurs prédictions pour éclairer les résultats des modèles au profit des agents opérationnels.

Vous êtes expert en mathématiques pour l'apprentissage automatique (algorithmique, optimisation, statistiques).

Enfin, vous disposez de connaissances transverses développement/déploiement/packaging applicatif (type conteneurs) et industrialisation de systèmes Data Science.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist , Leusden

Natuurlijk is Data Science een essentieel onderdeel van onze Digital Transformation doelstellingen.

En die zijn ambitieus. Want om de nummer 1 te blijven in de Do It Yourself-markt, moeten we data slim inzetten om innovatief en efficiënt te blijven.

Onze organisatie groeit, en met de toenemende focus op data-gedreven werken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Scientist die ons gedreven team komt versterken. Heb jij de technische expertise, strategisch inzicht en leiderschapskwaliteiten om data science binnen Intergamma naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!




Over de functie:

De afgelopen twee jaar hebben we als team al mooie stappen gezet in de richting van data-driven innovatie. We hebben de eerste producten opgeleverd en geanalyseerd. Nu staan we als team klaar om deze successen verder te optimaliseren en door te ontwikkelen. Als Data Scientist werk je aan het bouwen en optimaliseren van machine learning-modellen en datapipelines die direct bijdragen aan deze doelen. Je speelt een sleutelrol in het realiseren van de roadmap, met de focus op het vertalen van data naar concrete inzichten die onze bedrijfsdoelen ondersteunen.




Je bent onder meer verantwoordelijk voor:

Het vergelijken van prestaties van verschillende bouwmarkten om best practices te identificeren en processen te verbeteren.
Het analyseren van klantdata en productcombinaties om datagestuurde beslissingen te nemen die de klantbeleving verbeteren.
Het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor klantwaarde om klanttevredenheid en -loyaliteit te verhogen.
Het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde machine learning-modellen en deep learning-oplossingen die bijdragen aan de bedrijfsdoelstellingen.
Het bouwen en optimaliseren van complexe datapipelines en -architecturen.
Het vertalen van complexe business vraagstukken naar creatieve data science-oplossingen.
Het leiden van uitdagende projecten zoals het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor voorraadbeheer, het optimaliseren van prijsstrategieën, en het personaliseren van klantreizen door middel van machine learning.
Het motiveren en coachen van ons data science-team en het bieden van mentorship aan junior teamleden.
Het zichtbaar maken van data science binnen en buiten de organisatie door deel te nemen aan communities, het geven van presentaties, en het delen van kennis over markttrends.
Nauw samenwerken met teams zoals Marketing, Supply Chain en IT om cross-functionele data-oplossingen te ontwikkelen die onze bedrijfsprocessen optimaliseren.




Wat breng je mee:

Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie

Technische vaardigheden:

Diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen, deep learning, en geavanceerde data-analysetechnieken.
Ervaring met cloudplatforms zoals AWS, Azure, of GCP.
Beheersing van programmeertalen zoals Python, R, en SQL.
Ervaring met MLOps-tools en frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch of MLflow is een sterke pré.
Ervaring met relevante tools als Dataiku of Databricks
Het is een pre als je kennis hebt van AI en toolontwikkeling voor LLM

Business vaardigheden:

Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in het Nederlands, om complexe analyses helder over te brengen aan diverse stakeholders.
Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van data-oplossingen die direct bijdragen aan bedrijfsresultaten.

Leiderschapskwaliteiten:

Vermogen om een team te inspireren, motiveren en naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
Ervaring met het beheren van data science-projecten en stakeholdermanagement.




Wat wij bieden:

Een bruto fulltime maandsalaris van € 3.800,- tot € 6.000,- (Intergamma betaalt per periode van 4 weken), inschaling is afhankelijk van ervaring.
Telefoon en laptop van de zaak, een goede pensioenregeling, en 32 vakantiedagen.
Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om deels thuis te werken.
Een dynamische werkomgeving bij een marktleider die ontwikkeling, werkplezier en welzijn centraal stelt.
Ruime mogelijkheden voor innovatie, diversiteit en persoonlijke groei.
Een unieke kans om impact te maken in een groeiende en innovatieve organisatie.




Achter elke klus vind je Intergamma:

Intergamma is dé organisatie achter de doe-het-zelf-formules GAMMA en Karwei. Met bijna 160 eigen bouwmarkten in Nederland en België zijn we al jaren de onbetwiste nummer één duurzame retailer op de doe-het-zelfmarkt. In Europa horen we bij de 15 grootsten. En daar zijn we trots op!

Vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Leusden werken we met bijna 400 betrokken medewerkers samen om onze goede naam als omnichannel doe-het-zelf retailer hoog te houden. Dat doen we door volop te blijven investeren in verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven die ons verder de toekomst in helpen om gezond en winstgevend te blijven.




Sla nu de spijker op z’n kop!

Eerst nog vragen? Bel dan met [job.projectmanager.name] op [job.projectmanager.mobile]. Gelijk solliciteren kan ook via bijgaande sollicitatieknop.

Acquisitie n.a.v. vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
✨ ¿Te apasiona la tecnología y quieres impactar el sector energético? ✨

En Grupo DISA buscamos a una persona especialista en Ciencia de Datos para unirse a nuestro equipo de Transformación Digital. Disponemos de sedes en Tenerife, Gran Canaria y Madrid. Tu labor será clave para explotar el potencial de nuestros datos, generando modelos avanzados que optimicen procesos internos y redefinan la experiencia de las personas usuarias. 🔄




🎯 Tus principales responsabilidades

Diseñar y desarrollar modelos de Inteligencia Artificial, Aprendizaje Automático y Series Temporales para mejorar la toma de decisiones.
Aprovechar los activos de datos existentes e identificar nuevas oportunidades de análisis para impulsar el negocio.
Comprender los retos de nuestras personas usuarias y proponer soluciones innovadoras basadas en datos.




🛠️ Estas son las tecnologías con las que trabajarás:

Programación orientada a objetos: Python, Java, R 💻
Frameworks de Machine Learning: Scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch, TensorFlow 🤖
Ecosistemas Big Data: Databricks, Spark, Scala 📊
Herramientas de visualización: Dash, Power BI, Qlik, Tableau 📊
Sistemas de gestión de repositorios de código: Git 🎓




💡 Requisitos y por qué son importantes

Titulación académica en áreas de Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física o similar.




🌟 Valorable:

Experiencia previa en un puesto similar (entre 1-3 años).
Analítica avanzada y Machine Learning: La base para desarrollar modelos predictivos y optimizar procesos.
Análisis estadístico: Fundamental para interpretar datos y tomar decisiones basadas en evidencia.
Nivel alto de inglés: Nos permite trabajar con tecnologías globales y colaborar en entornos internacionales.
Conocimientos en protección de datos.




💼 Lo que ofrecemos:

✨ Contrato indefinido. Incorporación: 01/09/2025.

🎓 Formación continua y desarrollo profesional.

✨ Cultura de innovación y un equipo apasionado por la tecnología.

🚀 Flexibilidad horaria y opciones de teletrabajo. Si resides en uno de nuestros centros de trabajo (Tenerife / Gran Canaria / Madrid) podrás acudir a nuestras sedes un día a la semana para conocer al equipo de trabajo. Tu horario: lunes a jueves entrada flexible de 7:30 a 9:00 a compensar con la salida de 16:30 a 18:00. / Viernes entrada flexible de 08:00 a 9:00 a compensar con la salida de 14:00 a 15:00




Si eres una persona proactiva, con ganas de aprender y de transformar el sector energético con datos, ¡esta es tu oportunidad! 🚀 ¡Únete a Grupo DISA y forma parte del cambio! 🌟




Se solicitará durante el Proceso de Selección la documentación necesaria que certifique los datos informados en el curriculum.

Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

Si eres una persona proactiva, con ganas de aprender y de transformar el sector energético con datos, ¡esta es tu oportunidad! 🚀 ¡Únete a Grupo DISA y forma parte del cambio! 🌟


Se solicitará durante el Proceso de Selección la documentación necesaria que certifique los datos informados en el curriculum.

Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
🚀 Unleash Your Expertise as an AI/ML Engineer! Apply Now! ☁️




We dream big: we will be the largest AWS Premier Tier Partner in Central and Eastern Europe by 2026.

As an AI/ML Engineer, you will be part of SnapSoft's unique Data and AI service lines, with a specific focus on delivering data engineering and AI solutions across various projects. Furthermore, you will be responsible for designing and implementing Python-based data-processing services, data pipelines while being part of a team of highly skilled professionals focused on AI and ML projects. You can work in various fields, such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Large Language Models (LLMs), Recommendation Systems, conversational AI, chatbots, vector databases and other API-based process automation projects. Leveraging your python data engineer expertise, you can develop ETL pipelines and other data manipulation services and contribute to Data and AI architectures.




What you’ll be doing:

Develop highly scalable services realizing AI/ML functionalities (e.g. NLP, ML and AI models).
Implement various machine learning solutions addressing Computer Vision and NLP use cases.
Work with Large Language Models (LLMs), perform prompt engineering tasks.
Design and implement data transformation services for various use cases, such as automatic translation and transcription, Text2SQL, and intent and gesture recognition.
Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from various sources.
Use AWS cloud to implement AI/ML solutions (e.g. Bedrock, Sagemaker, Lambda, Textract)




You are looking for us, if you have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a AI/ML, Data Engineer or a similar role.
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with relevant frameworks and libraries, such as pandas, pyspark, numpy, sklearn, matplotlib, etc.
Familiarity with SQL.
Knowledge of some cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and their services.
Familiarity with AI/ML technologies (e.g., Computer Vision, NLP, anomaly detection).
Understanding AI tools and concepts like LLMs, ChatGPT, RAG, etc.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with ETL processes and tools are preferred (e.g. Airflow, AWS Glue).




What we offer

We believe that exceptional people deserve exceptional recognition:

A company culture based on autonomy and accountability
Flexible working hours
Cool office with great location in Budapest, nearby Deak Ferenc Square / Astoria
Macbook in order to be the most efficient in your daily tasks
Company-sponsored technical trainings
Company-sponsored trips to relevant, professional conferences
Medicover Health Insurance
English course with native teachers
AYCM SportPass contribution, yoga at the office, SnapSoft football
Regular cocktail parties, team buildings, an annual all staff 3-day summer retreat
Book club & SnapSoft library, Board game club & regular board game evenings




We are eager to work with experienced AI/ML Engineers motivated to expand their technical horizons across many of the above-listed technical disciplines. We do not look for a perfect fit for the above skills and experiences, but individuals with the potential to expand as part of high-performing data engineering teams across diverse projects.




If you're excited about this opportunity and believe you're the right fit, we'd love to hear from you!

Join us on our journey to become the AWS Partner of Choice in Central and Eastern Europe!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As a Data Scientist, your mission is to generate valuable insights by analyzing and modeling data from both internal and external sources. Your work will directly support business process optimization and data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will be responsible for developing and deploying machine learning and AI models, as well as delivering effective, scalable


ROLE

  • Viewing external data sources including the integration of sources without a native connection (e.g. web scraping);
  • Conducting exploratory analyses including pre-processing and cleansing of data (e.g. using Python or SQL);
  • Independent conception and development of machine learning and AI models (e.g. regressions, neural networks or LLMs);
  • Advising and supporting domain experts, e.g. in defining requirements and with regard to technical/methodological feasibility;
  • Visualization/provision of models and their results (e.g. via web applications or Power BI);
  • Application and optimization of DevOps processes, including the operation and further development of CI/CD pipelines;
  • Management of projects in the data science environment over the entire life cycle;
  • Coordination of rollouts, operation and further development with other experts (e.g. Data Engineer, Business Analyst or Product Owner).


PROFILE

  • University degree or equivalent training in aquantitative-empirical field (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Physics, Operations Research, or Computer Science);
  • Experience in the practical application of statistical modeling, machine learning and AI;
  • Good knowledge of common programming languages such as Python and SQL;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Azure (especially Azure Machine Learning Studio);
  • Experienced in working with Git;
  • Experience in Azure DevOps is an advantage;
  • Fluency in English (spoken and written) is required;
  • German language is a plus, but not mandatory.

Title: Data Scientist (DA)
Description:
Data Scientist

Fetcherr experts in deep learning, e-commerce, and digitization, Fetcherr disrupts traditional systems with its cutting-edge AI technology. At its core is the Large Market Model (LMM), an adaptable AI engine that forecasts demand and market trends with precision, empowering real-time decision-making. Specializing initially in the airline industry, Fetcherr aims to revolutionize industries with dynamic AI-driven solutions.

As our company continues its rapid growth, we're looking for a highly experienced and impactful Data Scientist to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who not only possesses deep technical expertise but also demonstrates the potential to lead and shape our data science initiatives as we scale. You will be instrumental in translating complex data into strategic business insights, driving data-driven decision-making, and mentoring team members.

Requirements:

You’ll be a great fit if…


You have 4+ years of hands-on data analytics and data science experience, with a proven track record of designing, developing, and deploying data models that directly impact business outcomes and drive significant value.
You are expert-level proficient in Python, encompassing the full data science and machine learning ecosystem (e.g., pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, statsmodels, PyTorch/TensorFlow for deeper ML applications). You can architect robust and scalable data solutions.
You possess exceptional communication, presentation, and storytelling skills, capable of translating highly complex technical findings into clear, concise, and actionable narratives for executive leadership, product teams, and non-technical stakeholders. You can influence strategic decisions through data.
You have extensive experience in proactively identifying complex business problems, translating them into well-defined analytical frameworks, and leading the end-to-end execution of data-driven solutions. You are adept at presenting findings, strategic recommendations, and potential risks to senior leadership.
You consistently identify, recommend, and lead the implementation of innovative analytical approaches and solutions to complex, ambiguous business challenges. You challenge the status quo and drive continuous improvement in our data science practices.
You are a natural leader and mentor, ready to guide and empower junior data scientists, foster a collaborative team environment, and drive accountability towards aggressive product and business timelines. You take ownership of team success.
You excel at structuring highly ambiguous business problems into clear, prioritized, and actionable research questions and sequential execution plans, often involving cross-functional collaboration.
You have a deep understanding of how to evaluate and optimize the performance of ML-powered systems from both a technical and critical business impact perspective. You can define relevant metrics, build monitoring solutions, and drive iterative improvements based on business goals.
Degree in a quantitative field such as Economy, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science,Data and Decision Sciences or a related discipline.
You are highly proficient in SQL (with extensive experience in BigQuery / Dataform / Cloud environments being a significant advantage) and demonstrate mastery of git for collaborative development and version control.
You demonstrate a strong commitment to continuous learning and staying abreast of the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and relevant technologies. You are keen to introduce new methodologies and tools to the team.
You have strong English communication skills, both written and verbal, and feel comfortable working in an environment where English is the primary language for collaboration, documentation, and presentations.


Great if you have them:


Deep domain knowledge and established expertise in the travel industry (e.g., airlines, transportation, hospitality), understanding its unique data challenges and opportunities.
Extensive practical experience with advanced analytical techniques such as causal inference (e.g., A/B testing design and analysis, difference-in-differences), uplift modeling, advanced anomaly detection, econometric modeling, or sophisticated pricing algorithms.
Proven experience with mathematical optimization techniques and their application to real-world business problems.
Experience building and deploying production-grade machine learning models (MLOps).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Gauss & Neumann, we are looking for PhDs, MSc and BS mathematics, physics and 

engineering to work with us in our office in Andorra. We do Search Engine Marketing (SEM) 

worldwide and work for international clients. We love and breath technology and everyone at 

the company has a tech background. 




We believe that advertising on search engines (SEM) should provide perfect answers to the 

users. Gauss & Neumann creates data structures and technologies that help our clients deliver 

a perfect response to queries and provide value to search engine customers like Google or 

Bing. 




What we look for: 

Professionals with a PhD, MSc or bachelor degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer 

Science, Software Engineering, or other engineering disciplines. We search for natural problem 

solvers with initiative that push the needle always a bit further and have the self-discipline to 

get things done. We look for people that have fun at work and create a great atmosphere with 

their teammates. We value personal attitude at the very top. 




Responsibilities: 

Design SEM keyword structures for international clients 

Create predictive algorithms for bidding in real time 

Create scripts for optimizing keyword structures 

Create technologies that disrupt the SEM industry 

Data research and visualization 

Manage campaign daily operations with large clients mainly in the United States. 




What you need to have:

Bachelor, MSc or PhD level degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or 

Software Engineering or similar engineering degree. 

Programming skills (Python, SQL, PHP, R...). 

Statistics knowledge 




Other skills we value:

English fluency (written and verbal) 

Project management experience 

Natural ability to deal with ratios and numbers 

Being up to date with programming libraries 

Willingness to learn and go beyond what's necessary. 




Why joining Gauss & Neumann: 

Gauss & Neumann provides an open environment of excellence with some of the best SEM 

professionals in the advertising industry. Most of our staff holds a PhD in Mathematics or 

Physics. G&N open culture provides unlimited vacation time, total daily autonomy, private 

insurance and the ability to run your own projects and take relevant decisions within the 

company. 




Location: 

We are looking for professionals to join our teams in Barcelona and Andorra.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our growing team! If you’re passionate about turning complex, scattered data into meaningful insights and have a strong command of Python and its data libraries — we want to hear from you.


Tasks



Aggregate and process structured and unstructured data from multiple sources (APIs, databases, CSVs, etc.)


Clean, transform, and analyze datasets for actionable insights


Apply clustering techniques and segmentation (e.g., K-Means, DBSCAN, hierarchical clustering)


Build and evaluate data models for internal tools and business needs


Communicate findings through clear visualizations and concise summaries


Collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and business stakeholders



Requirements



Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in data science or a similar analytical role


Strong proficiency in Python and commonly used libraries: pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, seaborn, etc.


Solid understanding of data structures, statistics, and machine learning fundamentals


Experience working with relational databases (SQL)


Ability to structure and interpret complex datasets independently


Communication skills, both written and verbal


References from previous projects or employers are required





Nice to Have:





Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP)


Familiarity with time-series data, anomaly detection, or recommender systems


Exposure to data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI



Benefits


We offer a range of benefits to support your growth, wellbeing, and long-term success:





Modern office in a central location, with collaborative workspaces and a friendly team culture


Extra vacation days beyond the national standard


Annual holiday and Christmas bonuses


Performance-based bonuses tied to individual and team results


Equity opportunity through our ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan)





Join Recommend as a Data Scientist and innovate content solutions for global brands. Be part of a dynamic team in thriving industry. Your expertise can make a difference!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

Sophos is a global leader and innovator of advanced security solutions for defeating cyberattacks. The company acquired Secureworks in February 2025, bringing together two pioneers that have redefined the cybersecurity industry with their innovative, native AI-optimized services, technologies and products. Sophos is now the largest pure-play Managed Detection and Response (MDR) provider, supporting more than 28,000 organizations. In addition to MDR and other services, Sophos’ complete portfolio includes industry-leading endpoint, network, email, and cloud security that interoperate and adapt to defend through the Sophos Central platform. Secureworks provides the innovative, market-leading Taegis XDR/MDR, identity threat detection and response (ITDR), next-gen SIEM capabilities, managed risk, and a comprehensive set of advisory services. Sophos sells all these solutions through reseller partners, Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Managed Security Service Providers (MSSPs) worldwide, defending more than 600,000 organizations worldwide from phishing, ransomware, data theft, other every day and state-sponsored cybercrimes. The solutions are powered by historical and real-time threat intelligence from Sophos X-Ops and the newly added Counter Threat Unit (CTU). Sophos is headquartered in Oxford, U.K. More information is available at www.sophos.com.




What You Will Do
Apply general security and ML domain knowledge to problems, identify new avenues of research to apply to current projects. 
With minimal supervision, define and execute experiments to support research on a project. 
Independently explore data curation and labeling, and feature extraction using domain expertise 
Document results of experiments, draw and support conclusions from those experiments; with assistance, evaluate business case/impact 
Contribute significantly to group publications and presentations, including (with assistance) occasional lead or sole authorship of academic publications and presenting work at academic or industry conferences 
Keep up to date on current research and developments in ML and security 
Contribute to internal tools, including identifying gaps where new functionality would be helpful, and implementing significant changes to tools/frameworks to accommodate new technologies. 
Integrate new models into existing frameworks and support hand-off to production 
Support existing model releases, including updates and improvements as needed, and integration with internal tools and systems for production. 





What You Will Bring
Fluent in machine learning and statistical concepts. 
General security domain knowledge, developing deeper expertise in some subdomain of security 
Able to identify scientific literature relevant to a problem, grasp it and apply it. 
Fluent in Python, a database query language like SQL, and familiar with a lower level language like C++. 
Good general writing skills and ability to translate complex concepts for general consumption. 
Competent at contributing to scientific papers with minimal assistance. Prior publications and talks a bonus. 








Ready to Join Us?

At Sophos, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives to fuel innovation. Research shows that candidates sometimes hesitate to apply if they don't check every box in a job description. We challenge that notion. Your unique experiences and skills might be exactly what we need to enhance our team. Don't let a checklist hold you back – we encourage you to apply.




What's Great About Sophos?

·   Sophos operates a remote-first working model, making remote work the primary option for most employees. However, some roles may necessitate a hybrid approach. While we are a remote first organization, applicants must have legal authorization to work in the jurisdiction where the position is posted, without requiring employer sponsorship.

·   Our people – we innovate and create, all of which are accompanied by a great sense of fun and team spirit

·   Employee-led diversity and inclusion networks that build community and provide education and advocacy

·   Annual charity and fundraising initiatives and volunteer days for employees to support local communities

·   Global employee sustainability initiatives to reduce our environmental footprint

·   Global fitness and trivia competitions to keep our bodies and minds sharp

·   Global wellbeing days for employees to relax and recharge 

·   Monthly wellbeing webinars and training to support employee health and wellbeing




Our Commitment To You

We’re proud of the diverse and inclusive environment we have at Sophos, and we’re committed to ensuring equality of opportunity.   We believe that diversity, combined with excellence, builds a better Sophos, so we encourage applicants who can contribute to the diversity of our team.  All applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, sex, gender reassignment, marital status, race, religion or belief, color, age, military veteran status, disability, pregnancy, maternity or sexual orientation.  We want to give you every opportunity to show us your best self, so if there are any adjustments we could make to the recruitment and selection process to support you, please let us know. 




Data Protection

If you choose to explore an opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Sophos, these details will be held by Sophos for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Sophos.  If you would like Sophos to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights.  For more information on Sophos’ data protection practices, please consult our Privacy Policy Cybersecurity as a Service Delivered | Sophos

  • General security domain knowledge, developing deeper expertise in some subdomain of security 
  • Able to identify scientific literature relevant to a problem, grasp it and apply it. 
  • Fluent in Python, a database query language like SQL, and familiar with a lower level language like C++. 
  • Good general writing skills and ability to translate complex concepts for general consumption. 
  • Competent at contributing to scientific papers with minimal assistance. Prior publications and talks a bonus. 



Ready to Join Us?

At Sophos, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives to fuel innovation. Research shows that candidates sometimes hesitate to apply if they don't check every box in a job description. We challenge that notion. Your unique experiences and skills might be exactly what we need to enhance our team. Don't let a checklist hold you back – we encourage you to apply.


What's Great About Sophos?

·   Sophos operates a remote-first working model, making remote work the primary option for most employees. However, some roles may necessitate a hybrid approach. While we are a remote first organization, applicants must have legal authorization to work in the jurisdiction where the position is posted, without requiring employer sponsorship.

·   Our people – we innovate and create, all of which are accompanied by a great sense of fun and team spirit

·   Employee-led diversity and inclusion networks that build community and provide education and advocacy

·   Annual charity and fundraising initiatives and volunteer days for employees to support local communities

·   Global employee sustainability initiatives to reduce our environmental footprint

·   Global fitness and trivia competitions to keep our bodies and minds sharp

·   Global wellbeing days for employees to relax and recharge 

·   Monthly wellbeing webinars and training to support employee health and wellbeing


Our Commitment To You

We’re proud of the diverse and inclusive environment we have at Sophos, and we’re committed to ensuring equality of opportunity.   We believe that diversity, combined with excellence, builds a better Sophos, so we encourage applicants who can contribute to the diversity of our team.  All applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, sex, gender reassignment, marital status, race, religion or belief, color, age, military veteran status, disability, pregnancy, maternity or sexual orientation.  We want to give you every opportunity to show us your best self, so if there are any adjustments we could make to the recruitment and selection process to support you, please let us know. 


Data Protection

If you choose to explore an opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Sophos, these details will be held by Sophos for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Sophos.  If you would like Sophos to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights.  For more information on Sophos’ data protection practices, please consult our Privacy Policy Cybersecurity as a Service Delivered | Sophos

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🌍 Data Scientist (AI | ESG | Sustainability) – Join the Tribe! 🚀




📍 Location: Amsterdam (Hybrid, 2–3 days in office)

📆 Full-time / Part-time

💰 Salary: €4.500 – €6.500 per month (depending on experience) + mobility budget, internet allowance, 24 vacation days




🌱 Why Join Data Tribes?

At Data Tribes, we believe that data is not just numbers, it’s stories waiting to be told and solutions waiting to make the world greener. We’re a startup with impact, helping organizations transform their data into sustainability-driven decisions that matter.




Here you’re not a job title, you’re potential. We value team spirit, fun and growth. Expect a place where you can debate fiercely, laugh loudly, and learn endlessly, because that’s how the best ideas are born. No corporate politics. Just a passionate team on a mission to change the way companies use data for good.




🔥 Your Role as Data Scientist

As a Data Scientist at Data Tribes, you turn complex questions into concrete, data-driven solutions. You’ll be:

✅ Translating business challenges into algorithms, dashboards, and models that drive real-world impact
✅ Working with structured and unstructured data to deliver insights that matter
✅ Building predictive models, machine learning pipelines, and statistical analyses
✅ Creating data stories and visualizations that bring insights to life (because visuals stick better than dry facts)
✅ Collaborating closely with clients, often leading projects from discovery to delivery
✅ Exploring advanced methods like Graph Neural Networks, Topic Modeling, LLMs, Deep Learning, Clustering, Optimization and Tree-Based Models




💡 What We’re Looking For

Must-haves:

🎯 Experience as a Data Scientist / Data Analyst with a proven track record
🎯 Strong skills in Python, R, or similar for modeling & analysis
🎯 Knowledge of machine learning and statistical methods
🎯 Ability to switch between business and tech worlds with ease

Nice-to-haves:

🌍 Experience with ESG / sustainability data / agri, food and beverages
🤖 Familiarity with LLMs, Deep Learning, or Neural Networks
📊 Experience with visualization & storytelling tools (Power BI, Tableau, Plotly, etc.)
🔍 Knowledge of data engineering basics (SQL, pipelines, cloud platforms)




🎁 What’s In It for You?

🚀 Impact & purpose: work on projects that make a difference in ESG & sustainability

🌍 Hybrid freedom: flexibility to balance office buzz with home focus time

📚 Growth: training budget, certifications, and the chance to explore new AI/ML methods

💰 Rewards: salary €4.500–€6.500 + mobility budget, laptop, internet + mobile phone allowance, 24 vacation days

👕 Culture: work in a place where fun, teamwork, and innovation come first




📈 Your Growth Path

At Data Tribes, we see growth as a shared journey. From Data Scientist you can evolve into:

Senior / Lead Data Scientist
AI/ML Specialist
Data Science Consultant with ESG focus

You’ll define your path. We’ll back you with mentorship, projects and trust.




🎯 Ready to Join the Tribe?

If you want your algorithms, dashboards, and ideas to shape a greener tomorrow, this is your chance.




👉 Apply now and let’s turn data into impact, together.

Show more

Title: AI Developer (Machine Learning)
Description:
Role: AI Developer (Machine Learning)

Location: Krakow, Poland (Hybrid)

Contract Duration: 6+ Months

Start Date: ASAP

Work Timings: Regular business hours

Remote Option: Hybrid (onsite + remote flexibility)




Role Overview

We are seeking an experienced Machine Learning Developer to join a leading financial services organization. The role involves building production-ready models for intelligent document processing, driving innovation in AI solutions, and collaborating with business and technology teams to deliver scalable, resilient applications.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and deploy production-ready machine learning models for content extraction and classification from images and text-based sources.
Collaborate with business stakeholders, product managers, and technical teams to translate requirements into technical solutions.
Design and build Python/ML/OCR-based components, including Generative AI models.
Create, test, and iterate on new features and existing solutions to ensure scalability and efficiency.
Support the end-to-end lifecycle of applications, including deployment, testing, monitoring, and production support.
Ensure secure and resilient delivery of ML solutions, focusing on application and API cybersecurity.




Required Experience

Strong hands-on experience in Document AI / Intelligent Document Processing, leveraging both traditional ML and Generative AI models.
Proficiency in Python with expertise in machine learning, deep learning, NLP, image processing, and OCR.
Experience working with open-source ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, Spacy, OpenCV, Regex (or equivalents).
Proven track record of deploying ML solutions into production environments.
Strong understanding of cybersecurity and application resilience in ML/AI solutions.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer- Shaping the Future of Retail

 

About the Job:

 

Are you passionate about building the future of physical retail? At YQ App, we startup revolutionizing data-driven solutions for brick-and-mortar stores, we're empowering retailers to embrace digital innovation for smarter, more efficient, and sustainable operations—creating impactful, positive commerce experiences. Join our team of agile thinkers, tech creators, and change-makers to help build the future of retail.

 

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll be building the nervous system for the future of physical retail, enabling stores to “connect” with customers in fundamentally new and delightful ways. Think personalized experiences, and a seamless, intuitive shopping journey—all powered by our firmware.

 

Key Responsibilities:

 

·     Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models for sensor data, consumer behavior analysis, and predictive analytics.

·     Work with hardware sensor data streams and integrate them into our SaaS platform.

·     Partake in developing data collection and preprocessing pipelines using Go, SQL and Python.

Deep dive into:

·     Test, debug, and validate sensor data communication protocols such as Bluetooth (BLE), Wi-Fi, or other relevant protocols.

·     Optimize models for performance, scalability, and latency, including real-time inference.

·     Package and integrate predictive services into existing infrastructure

·     Participate in data preprocessing, feature engineering, and labeling.

·     Maintain model versioning, monitoring, and evaluation in production.

·     Stay updated with the latest ML research and implement state-of-the-art algorithms.

 

 

Qualifications:

·     Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine Learning, or a related field.

·   Strong programming proficiency in Python, with experience in Go and SQL—demonstrated through clean, maintainable code.

·   Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms (supervised/unsupervised), time-series modelling, and predictive analytics.

·   Proven track record of owning end-to-end ML projects—from data collection to deployment and validation.

·   Experience with experiment tracking tools (e.g., MLflow, Weights & Biases) and reproducible research practices.

·   Ability to analyse, summarize, and present complex experimental results clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

·   Excellent communication skills in English;

Nice-to-Have:

·   Experience with SQL-based data management and large-scale dataset curation.

·   Familiarity with IoT systems, embedded development, and edge computing environments.

·   Hands-on experience with wireless protocols (Bluetooth/BLE, Wi-Fi) and sensor integration.

·   Understanding of electromagnetic wave physics or signal propagation in retail environments (a strong plus).

·   Prior exposure to real-time, low-latency ML inference in production.

·   Experience working with geospatial data or sensor fusion techniques to enable accurate, real-time location tracking within physical spaces.

 

Skills/Abilities:

 

·     Ownership Mindset: Self-driven and proactive—able to lead projects from concept to deployment with minimal supervision.

·   Full-Lifecycle Expertise: Comfortable working across the entire ML pipeline—from data wrangling and feature engineering to model optimization and deployment. Ready to dive into the details when needed.

·   Analytical Curiosity: Skilled at exploring complex, high-dimensional datasets to uncover patterns and drive insight-led innovation.

·   Creative Problem-Solving: Stays informed on the latest advancements in ML and AI; able to propose novel, practical solutions tailored to retail challenges.

·   Collaborative Spirit: Excels in cross-functional teams—works seamlessly with hardware engineers, software developers, and QA to deliver integrated, high-impact solutions.

·   Adaptability: Thrives in a fast-paced startup environment, where agility and continuous learning are at the core.

 

What We Look for at YQ App:

 

We don't just hire engineers; we build a team of obsessive problem-solvers. You’re driven by the desire to create exceptional products, aren't afraid to challenge the status quo, and thrive in a collaborative environment where every voice is valued. If you're someone who finds joy in tackling the most complex technical challenges and building solutions that matter, then you'll fit right in.

 

What's In It For You at YQ App?

 

At YQ App, we’re dedicated to creating an environment where you can thrive while driving innovation in physical retail through IoT solutions.

 

*  Work-Life Balance: Enjoy up to 30 days of "work from anywhere" annually, empowering you to work from wherever inspires you most. Recharge with 27 days of paid vacation to keep your creativity and energy at their peak.

*  Professional Growth: Tap into a flexible learning budget for books, courses, conferences, or certifications to fuel your growth in our dynamic startup environment.

*  Smart Commuting: Get a complimentary public transport pass to make your commute seamless and eco-friendly. Our office is ideally situated with excellent public transportation access.

*  Workplace Perks: Stay energized with unlimited access to high-quality coffee at our vibrant office.

*  Performance-Driven Compensation: Begin with a competitive package starting at €60,000 gross annually, tailored to reflect your expertise and impact. Earn an annual bonus based on your individual contributions and YQ App’s success. Enjoy opportunities for salary growth tied to your performance and the company’s achievements.

*  Equity Participation: Share in YQ App’s future success with stock options, aligning your goals with our mission to revolutionize retail.

*  Inclusive Team: As an equal opportunity employer, we embrace diverse backgrounds and ideas, creating a collaborative space where everyone’s voice drives innovation.

 

Before You Apply to YQ App:

 

At YQ App, we’re a passionate startup dedicated to revolutionizing physical retail through innovative IoT and data-driven solutions. We thrive in a fast-paced, ambitious environment where we push ourselves and each other to achieve excellence. This creates incredible opportunities for learning, innovation, and career growth, but it also demands significant commitment and enthusiasm. If you’re excited about the role and ready to bring your absolute best to help shape the future of retail, we can’t wait to see your application!

 

How to Apply:

 

1. Send your resume, cover letter, and portfolio (GitHub/GitLab links) to careers@yqapp.net

2. Use ‘Machine Learning' as the email subject

 

We look forward to learning how you can contribute to our vision!

What's In It For You at YQ App?

*  Professional Growth: Tap into a flexible learning budget for books, courses, conferences, or certifications to fuel your growth in our dynamic startup environment.

*  Smart Commuting: Get a complimentary public transport pass to make your commute seamless and eco-friendly. Our office is ideally situated with excellent public transportation access.

*  Workplace Perks: Stay energized with unlimited access to high-quality coffee at our vibrant office.

*  Performance-Driven Compensation: Begin with a competitive package starting at €60,000 gross annually, tailored to reflect your expertise and impact. Earn an annual bonus based on your individual contributions and YQ App’s success. Enjoy opportunities for salary growth tied to your performance and the company’s achievements.

Title: AI Engineer – Machine Learning & Intelligenza Artificiale
Description:
Chi siamo

Netgroup è un’azienda italiana con oltre 30 anni di esperienza nell’Information & Communication Technology, specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni digitali sicure, scalabili e ad alto contenuto tecnologico. Grazie a una profonda expertise nella Cybersecurity e nelle tecnologie emergenti, progettiamo sistemi innovativi che coniugano AI, machine learning e sicurezza per rispondere alle sfide più complesse del mercato.




Chi ricerchiamo

Cerchiamo un AI Engineer appassionato e motivato, con solide competenze nello sviluppo e deployment di modelli di Machine Learning e Deep Learning. La figura ideale è capace di lavorare in team multidisciplinari, affrontando con creatività e rigore tecnico le sfide legate all’integrazione di AI in contesti applicativi avanzati.




Responsabilità principali

Sviluppare e ottimizzare modelli di Machine Learning e Deep Learning utilizzando framework come TensorFlow, Keras e PyTorch.
Progettare soluzioni avanzate di Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision e AI Generativa.
Realizzare sistemi di chatbot, assistenti virtuali e agenti AI autonomi, integrando tecnologie di retrieval e knowledge base.
Gestire il ciclo di vita dei modelli ML (MLOps), incluse attività di containerizzazione, deployment e monitoraggio con Docker, Kubernetes e tool di serving come FastAPI e Gradio.
Collaborare con team di ricerca e sviluppo per la prototipazione e validazione di soluzioni innovative.
Contribuire alla documentazione tecnica, pubblicazioni e alla protezione della proprietà intellettuale.




Competenze richieste

Ottima conoscenza di Python e delle librerie scientifiche (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn). Gradita esperienza anche in C++ e Java.
Esperienza comprovata con almeno uno dei principali framework di ML/DL: TensorFlow/Keras o PyTorch.
Competenza in NLP (Hugging Face Transformers, spaCy, NLTK) e tecniche di gestione della conoscenza basate su embedding semantici.
Esperienza in Computer Vision con librerie e framework dedicati (OpenCV, YOLO, Detectron2).
Conoscenza di AI generativa e LLM, inclusa integrazione di API commerciali e open-source (GPT-4, Anthropic Claude, Llama).
Familiarità con database vettoriali per ricerca semantica (FAISS, Pinecone, Milvus, ecc.).
Capacità di sviluppo di chatbot e agenti AI utilizzando piattaforme come Dialogflow, Rasa o Microsoft Bot Framework.
Esperienza in MLOps, deployment di modelli e containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes).
Laurea magistrale o PhD in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica o discipline affini con almeno 3 anni di esperienza.




Perché entrare in Netgroup

Opportunità di lavorare su progetti di frontiera nell’ambito AI e cybersecurity.
Ambiente di lavoro stimolante, dinamico e orientato all’innovazione.
Collaborazione in team multidisciplinari e progetti internazionali.
Crescita professionale continua e formazione sulle tecnologie più avanzate.




Se vuoi fare la differenza nel campo dell’Intelligenza Artificiale applicata alla sicurezza e all’innovazione, inviaci il tuo CV!




Ti invitiamo, prima di presentare la candidatura, a leggere attentamente l’informativa Netgroup sul trattamento dei dati personali, conforme agli articoli 13 e 14 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679, disponibile al seguente link:

https://www.netgroup.it/informativa-recruiting.pdf

Show more

  • Conoscenza di AI generativa e LLM, inclusa integrazione di API commerciali e open-source (GPT-4, Anthropic Claude, Llama).
  • Familiarità con database vettoriali per ricerca semantica (FAISS, Pinecone, Milvus, ecc.).
  • Capacità di sviluppo di chatbot e agenti AI utilizzando piattaforme come Dialogflow, Rasa o Microsoft Bot Framework.
  • Esperienza in MLOps, deployment di modelli e containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Laurea magistrale o PhD in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica o discipline affini con almeno 3 anni di esperienza.


Perché entrare in Netgroup

  • Opportunità di lavorare su progetti di frontiera nell’ambito AI e cybersecurity.
  • Ambiente di lavoro stimolante, dinamico e orientato all’innovazione.
  • Collaborazione in team multidisciplinari e progetti internazionali.
  • Crescita professionale continua e formazione sulle tecnologie più avanzate.


Se vuoi fare la differenza nel campo dell’Intelligenza Artificiale applicata alla sicurezza e all’innovazione, inviaci il tuo CV!


Ti invitiamo, prima di presentare la candidatura, a leggere attentamente l’informativa Netgroup sul trattamento dei dati personali, conforme agli articoli 13 e 14 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679, disponibile al seguente link:

https://www.netgroup.it/informativa-recruiting.pdf

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Licorne Society a été missionné par une startup en pleine croissance pour les aider à trouver leur Ingénieur IA

Définition du poste

Au sein de l’équipe R&D, votre mission consiste à participer à des développements de spécifications fonctionnelles données, dans le domaine des data sciences et de l’intelligence artificielle.

Mission du poste / activités spécifiques / responsabilités

Vous êtes responsable de faire évoluer l’application suivant ses objectifs temps réél et gain en

précision des modèles.

Votre mission principale consiste à des développements de modèles de Machine Learning appliqués à la vision par ordinateur (traitement d’images et de modèles 3D intra-oraux).

Pour Cela, Vous

✓ serez responsable de la mise en place de :


Segmentation 2D et 3D
Point cloud completion
Shape fitting
Etc.


✓ optimiserez les modèles existants,

✓ définirez de nouveaux modèles,


rester à jour de l’état de l’art,
réaliser des POC suivant des dead-lines orientées production
Argumenter de façon écrite vos résultats


✓ Collaboration étroite avec les autres ingénieurs pour assurer l'interconnexion des modules

logiciels

Compétences & connaissances Techniques

Environnement

✓ Bon niveau pour les environnements linux (Ubuntu)

✓ Notion de base pour l’environnement Windows

Framework de deep learning et algortihme

✓ Très bonnes connaissances des principes de base et des briques de base (Nets classiques,

Layers, monitoring d’un apprentissage).

✓ Savoir utiliser le framework PyTorch.

Langage et librairie

✓ Maîtrise de PyTorch

✓ Bon niveau de Python

✓ Notions de base du C++

4.4 Logiciel et outils

✓ Maitrise des outils de configuration (CMake)

✓ Maitrise des outils de versionnage (Git)

Capacité liée à l’emploi

✓ Sens de l’initiative et de l’autonomie

✓ Force de proposition

✓ Passionné par son domaine

✓ Sens de l’organisation et rigueur

✓ Sens du détail

✓ Sens relationnel

✓ Respecter la confidentialité

✓ Intégrer les valeurs de l’entreprise qui exigent qualité et professionnalisme.

✓ Suivre les instructions de travail, le règlement intérieur et les chartes de l’entreprise.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Nexeo Belgium is looking for a Medior/Senior Data Scientist – Generative AI to join the Artificial Intelligence Tribe of one of the top financial institutions in Belgium.




As part of the team, you will:

Design and develop AI applications (e.g., virtual assistants) to improve customer experience, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
Apply a broad range of analytical methodologies, including Generative AI (Prompt Engineering, RAG, fine-tuning, speech-to-text, agentic applications, image generation/interpretation) and predictive AI techniques.
Leverage your expertise in Python to develop and deploy AI solutions in production using modern tools and frameworks.
Collaborate in an Agile environment with a multidisciplinary team, sharing expertise and driving innovation.
Access and analyze one of the most diverse and rich datasets in the market.
Present project outcomes directly to top management.

Your profile:

Master’s degree in a quantitative field (statistics, mathematics, engineering, or equivalent).
At least 3 years of relevant experience in Data Science and Analytics.
Strong expertise in Python, deep learning, and pre-trained models.
Experience with Generative AI frameworks (LangChain, Haystack, etc.) is a plus.
Previous experience with GenAI applications in the financial sector is an asset.
Fluent in Dutch or French, and fluent in English.
Business-oriented mindset, excellent communication skills, and ability to work in multicultural environments.
Proactive, autonomous, and able to learn quickly new techniques when needed.

Work location:

Hybrid model: 50% on-site / 50% homeworking.

We offer:

A competitive package.
The opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI technologies on impactful business cases.
A collaborative environment fostering innovation and knowledge-sharing.

Ready to shape the future of AI in the financial sector?

Apply now and join Nexeo Belgium.

#AI #GenerativeAI #DataScience #MachineLearning #FinanceJobs #Consulting #Belgium #Python

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Om oss

Bumbee Labs är ett innovativt techbolag i scale-up-fasen som gör avtryck globalt med vår unika produkt. Vi har utvecklat en unik metod för att mäta och analysera flödesdata – att förstå hur människor rör sig och beter sig – med hjälp av Wi-Fi-teknologi.

Vår kärnprodukt är data – men ännu viktigare är de insikter vi skapar av den.




Din roll

Som Data Scientist kommer du att vara en del av vårt analysteam och arbeta praktiskt med att förädla vår data, utveckla modeller och säkerställa att våra leveranser håller hög kvalitet. Du kommer att bidra till att förbättra våra metoder för kalibrering, validering och analys – och därigenom skapa ännu bättre insikter för våra kunder.

Du arbetar nära våra utvecklare, implementationsteam och kundansvariga för att förstå både den tekniska sidan och kundernas behov. Rollen är en blandning av analys, problemlösning och samarbete.




Ansvarsområden
Analysera och bearbeta stora datamängder
Bidra till utveckling och förbättring av statistiska modeller
Stödja vid uppsättning och kalibrering av nya installationer
Säkerställa datakvalitet och bidra till validering av resultat
Samarbeta med kollegor för att omsätta kundernas behov i datadrivna lösningar
Bidra med insikter och underlag till visualiseringar (t.ex. i Power BI), men utan krav på att själv bygga dashboards




Vem vi söker

Du är analytisk, noggrann och tycker om att arbeta med data i olika former. Du är nyfiken på hur människor rör sig i fysiska miljöer och vill använda din kompetens till att skapa insikter som gör skillnad.

Vi ser gärna att du har:

Erfarenhet av dataanalys och statistisk modellering
Programmeringsvana i Python
Kunskap i PostgreSQL och gärna PostGIS
Intresse för geospatial data och mobilitetsmönster
Viss erfarenhet av datavisualisering (Power BI, Tableau eller liknande) är meriterande, men inget krav




Vår kultur

På Bumbee Labs kombinerar vi djup teknisk kompetens med en kreativ och samarbetsinriktad arbetsmiljö. Vi brainstormar, testar och utmanar idéer varje dag – och vi har kul längs vägen. Vårt kontor ligger i hjärtat av Stockholm, där kreativitet och innovation får utrymme att blomma.




Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens platsanalys med hjälp av Wi-Fi-data? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist – Transformez la mobilité de demain
Description:
Data Scientist – Transformez la mobilité de demain




Notre partenaire, une software company belge, recherche un Data Scientist dans le but de renforcer leur département IA.




Data Scientist – L’entreprise :




Notre partenaire est l’une des entreprises tech les plus innovantes de Belgique. Elle propose des solutions sur mesure à ses clients dans les domaines de la Sécurité, Mobilité, Environnement & L’analyse.




Sa technologie unique au monde lui a rapidement permis d’être leader sur le territoire belge et de se lancer à la conquête du territoire européen.




Cette entreprise à taille humaine vous permettra d’évoluer dans des équipes jeunes et dynamiques ou il fait bon vivre.




Data Scientist – Le rôle:




Premièrement, la structure aime avant tout les gens curieux, collaboratifs, désireux d'avoir un impact et qui valorisent l'innovation, l'autonomie et l'esprit d'équipe.




Deuxièmement, dans ce poste spécifique, il sera important pour vous d'avoir de l'expérience sur les points suivants : Python Data Processing & Visualisation libraries – ML & Deep Learning




L’objectif principal sera d’accélérer et d’améliorer la prise de décision des acteurs du monde de la mobilité via vos prédictions et des outils d’Intelligence Artificielle




Data Scientist – Le profil :




Vous disposez d’un Master Degree en Computer Science / Engineering
Vous avez 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer
Vous maitrisez Python et ses librairies de visualisations, Hadoop – Spark – Kafka sont un plus




Data Scientist – L’offre:




Salaire annuel allant jusque 85.000 € (en fonction de votre expérience)
Optimisation fiscal brut / net – Régime de droit d’auteur
Assurance groupe & Hospitalisation
Frais de représentation / net – 100 €
Véhicule de fonction + carte essence ou Budget Mobilité
Bénéficiez d’horaires flexibles (2/3 jours de télétravail/semaine)
Participez à des Teams Building de folie
Avoir des perspectives d’évolutions et prendre le Lead sur une équipe ML
Rejoignez une structure en pleine expansion et remplie d’ambition




If you are interested, even if you don’t match 100% of the required skills - please apply - your application is welcome !
